review_body: The location is very convenient, just only 5 minutes from the nearest station and 2 stops from Shinjuku. The cafe on the first floor is also available for 24 hours which you can enjoy many international manu!

If you're looking for that final push to book this place. This is it!As a solo female traveller, I'm not the biggest fan of sharing rooms because I don't like the pressure of always being mindful of my stuff spread out in the room--for that, I always opt for getting my own room. This hotel has the best rates for solo traveling that I saw for Tokyo. So let's talk about things I love about this place.1. CostThis place is affordable, of the many locations I checked, this is one of the most affordable ones.2. LocationThe location is quiet and not on the main road which is great because it's perfect for your shut-eye. But it still remains very accessible to train stations, it's 3 minutes away from Hatagaya Station which is just two stations away from Shinjuku which means cheap train fares despite not being covered by the subway pass. It is also just 15 minutes away from the train station that is covered by the subway pass.3. Access to Food and Stores NearbyThe vicinity is also with a lot of convenience stores, hole-in-the-walls, drugstores, and restaurants. But, you need not worry about that because the hotel itself has a 24-hour cafe that is reasonably-priced.4. RoomsThe rooms are great. They're not the most spacious but I think that's the norm in Tokyo. The entrance might seem underwhelming if you're tall, but the ceilings are higher inside, I promise. :)The room is equipped with all the basic necessities you'll need, but the hotel offers more free rental equipment for other things you might need. I find that smart and considerate! Plus, I got my own room which is all that I really look for. That's a plus, yes, given most accommodations I found in the same price range has shared bathrooms.I wanna address a review I read that the toilet stinks, it's not true for me. If you smell something, just close the toilet lid and you should be good. They also offer deodorizers and humidifiers for free, if you ever encounter it.I went in the summer and their air-conditioning is perfect!5. BreakfastThe free breakfast is bread, juice, coffee, tea, and soup. Though it's the same everyday variation comes in the jams, juice flavor, and soup. But the highlight of this is the duration, they start early and end really late which is perfect if you need to leave early or just want to sleep longer and wake up late.6. WiFi and Other AmenitiesWiFi is great! It's reliable in all locations. Our Muslim friends are also considered as there is a prayer room available. :)7. StaffThis, I think is the gem of the place. For Non-Japanese, they speak and understand English! Great customer service in Japan is common, but Sakura Hotel Hatagay takes it to the next level. First off, thank you to the staff for the little things:a. Letting me get cold water in my water bottle from the bar every morning and every nightb. Helping me with my questions about getting around and how to use my subway passes together with the IC Cardsc. Giving me band-aids; this seems like a little think but I bruised myself and just needed one band-aid, buying a whole box in the drugstore seemed wasteful as I only needed one but the staff (maybe Hako, the one in your Instagram account photos) gave me two. I appreciate that very much!Most especially, I stumbled upon an issue in Tokyo and they went above and beyond to help me. Short of it is, I got left behind by my overnight bus to Osaka due to misinformation from the person who booked me. I was so tired that night, feeling lost and overwhelmed somewhere in Tokyo Station. I called the hotel and everything started to just be too much for me and started crying on the phone whilst talking to the Assistant Manager of the Hotel. I was asking them for help to contact the bus company and they were more than happy to do it for me. Filled with anxiety on the phone, they have calmed me down and offered to go back to the hotel and sort the entire thing out. They even went ahead and offered me a discounted room for the night. But since I planned to leave in the morning, they offered for me to just stay in the cafe since it's open for 24 hours. When I got to the hotel, they could not be any more accommodating and friendly towards my stressed self. They helped me just settle in the cafe with my laptop and even as far as booking a new ticket to Osaka, helping me find the cheapest rates online. That was so stressful for me as someone traveling alone, but their help made it all okay for me. I contemplated leaving the next night but they also gave me tips that there is a typhoon coming and leaving soon is a wiser decision. True enough, when I got to Osaka, a typhoon hit Tokyo which would have stranded me in Tokyo even further.To Sakura Hotel Hatagaya, thank you to the Assistant Manager who helped me and his staff on the night of September 7, 2019. I got your business cards but have not had the chance to unpack to look for them (I apologize), but I wanted to express my utmost gratitude towards your team in Hatagaya! You made my Japan experience memorable and I cannot wait to come back.

The hotel is cozy. Stuffs are very friendly. Place is close to train station and many convenient stores. The hotel food was different from what you find in local Japanese restaurant. Hotel stay comes with breakfast depending on your bookings. The breakfast starts at 4 am which is very early. For those who are to travel early can have breakfast before the journey. One of the stuff can speak multiple languages which was impressive.

It's a very nice hotel, with a perfect location for reaching Tokyo center. Shops are also close so you can buy groceries easily. Metro station is 2 minutes walk, Shinjuku only 2 stops. Hotel staff is very friendly and helpful. And the hotel restaurant can make it easy to eat something before your daily rout to the city. Definitely recommended!

Room was clean. Very comfy ambience. Hotel staff are all friendly and accommodating. We get the value of our money in this hotel. Will definitely stay here again next time I visit Tokyo. Will recommend this to friends.

We really enjoyed our 4-nights stay at Sakura Hatagaya. The hotel is clean and cozy. The staff is very kind and always ready to help. The location is perfect: in two minutes you can reach the metro station, visit one of the best sento we have been and have dinner in one of the traditional restaurants in the neighborhood. We definitely recommend it.

I enjoyed my stay in Sakura Hotel Hatagaya because it is near the Hatagaya station, two stations away from Shinjuku Station. It is affordable compare to other hotels in Tokyo. The room and toilet is narrow, and difficult to move for big people. The staffs are friendly and approachable. I will recommend to my friends and family.

Room was clean. Staff were helpful and spoke english. Breakfast could be improved as they served only bread everyday. Location was very good as it was located in a quiet neighbourhood but yet very near to shops and eateries and only 2 stops away from Shinjuku station.

We booked a double room, it was clean and tidy but a bit too small to cater two luggage. Sound proof was weak as we could hear laughter all night from the next door.But staff services and breakfast were very nice, location was quite convenient, drug store and convenience store were nearby and surrounded by many restaurants, which could better our stay!

Room was very small (which is expected of Tokyo) but was not an issue because we were too busy sight seeing. Everything is very clean. The hotel is less than a block away from a subway station and is right next to restaurants and drug stores. The staff is very friendly and courteous. They also speak English which is helpful. Our stay included a daily “breakfast special” which was a vegetable stew of sorts (ratatouille?), a small salad, bread, soup, and scrambled eggs, as well as coffee/tea/juice. All very good.

Great hospitality, service and facilities. Room abit small but you get what you pay for and honestly its really worth the stay. Very homely and 2 stops away from shinjuku station. Wouldnt mind going back again.

Overall affordable pricing, near to train station and shops. Halal cafe which is indeed a saviour. Comfortable room. But 1 thing is when cleaning up room, the queen bed is usually left undone and the trash not cleared.

Overall staff are very accommodating, friendly and knowledgeable. Hotel location 3 to 5 mins away from train station, Family Mart and nearby establishments, I will definitely recommend this to all travelers who would like to explore Tokyo Japan.

Stayed here for 4 nights with my boyfriend in October 2019 on a trip to Japan. The hotel is in a great location and the staff are lovely. The rooms are basic and there was a slight smell from the bathroom but other than that the hotel room was clean. Great cafe downstairs open 24/7.

Room was clean and decent size for Tokyo although the bathroom was very small and had a smell. Staff were very helpful and most welcoming. The location was convenient with local stores around and a connection on the underground.

The room was super tiny and not that clean, everything felt cheap, the bed was hard, the wifi was bad. No japanese toilet in the room, no kettle, no place for luggage, no amenities. The breakfast included bread mainly. The walls of the room were paper thin. Its location is not really ideal, there's nothing around to do. In conclusion, this place is way overpriced, I would have expected to pay half of what I did for such a bad experience. We changed to another hotel the moment we could.

This is the 3rd time I have used Sakura hotel Hatagaya for a trip with a small Scottish Judo club. this time we had a group of 11. communication from booking to arrival was brilliant. We were made to feel very welcome on arrival and the staff were all really happy and fun with great English. they made our children feel safe and welcome and were only too happy to help with any enquiries or requests. Cleaning staff were brilliant and efficient and the rooms were functional, clean and quiet.We will be using this hotel again next time we visit in a years time and would not look past it for future tours. Thank you everyone for an amazing trip which you helped make easy for us.

This is my third time staying in this hotel because of the very accessible location and availability of Halal food. They now have a new halal chicken ramen which is nice but sells out quick. My only negative experience was some of the tv channels didn't have a smooth transmission and keeps getting cut. I'm not sure if it is the tv as I was able to view all the channels smoothly in the rooms I was in previously.It was the first time I'm staying this hotel during a typhoon and I'm impressed that it was able to withstand Typhoon Hagibis with electricity and water still available after it passed. Overall, I enjoyed my stay and will come back again whenever I visit Tokyo.

Sakura hotel is nice and clean. It has a good location in cozy neighborhoods. The staff is helpful and professional. The rooms are very small, but work. A simple breakfast is included. The hotel serves food and has a furnished courtyard adjacent to the entrance.

This is my second time to stay in this hotel because of easy of accessibility to hotel location and the price is competitive with good service. The hotel staff is also very friendly. I surely stay in this hotel in the next chance.

Love this hotel, the staff is really friendly and helpful. the location is perfect, 1 minute away from the train station. the room is a little bit small but everything inside the room was excellent. thank you Sakura Hotel, i will surely comeback.

Located 2 stations away from the centre Shinjuku. Nearby convenience stores and supermarket and 7-11. Friendly staffs and knowledgeable. Provide free coffee and bread for breakfast (4:30-11am). Room is small, maximum 2 people can fit in. Bed is comfy(firm).

We started this trip by this hotel very close to the metro. Small Japanese room with sufficient comfort but watch out for large suitcases! Simple breakfast. Possibility to eat also on site. Friendly welcome. If you want to be disoriented, this is an address to have.

To start of, Sakura Hatagaya located just a minute from the subway station. Having near the station made traveling throughout Tokyo very easy. There are many eateries and convenient stores nearby. Surprisingly their cafe that open 24 hours served tasty foods with reasonable prices. However, their triple room that we booked really need to be refurbished. And they have the smallest lift with a pink carpet pasted on the wall of the lift. Perhaps they were looking for the fastest and cheapest option to modernize the lift.Not all of the staffs were friendly and it was a surprise to us. It really depend on who you meet. If you really need a hotel that near to a station with many eateries around, this is the place to consider but nothing else. With their price range and limited amenities, room that need refurbished, there are some place better.

Good hotel at a good location near Shinjuku station, helpful staff and a lovely "smaller" neighborhood. Me second time here, and for the price and location I really recommend it. Regular double room was a little small for 2 tall europeans with luggage for 2 weeks, corner double is much better.

Not fancy, but great staff, great location, and despite being a tad small it's really quite cozy and nice. We loved it, and I came back and stayed again and had just as nice an experience. Cafe has some nice vegetarian and halal options.

Price (60% discount through agoda) & location were great, staff were friendly & had good English skills. Free breakfast of bread & coffee were appreciable. I liked that there was a baggage storage area behind the front desk for people who arrived early, check in & check out were quick and painless. Overall I'd recommend this place.

Stayed here as a solo traveler, very convenient to train; friendly and helpful staff, more than met my needs for my stay in Tokyo. A breakfast is included, convenient store almost at the door of the hotel. Pleased with my choice to stay here during my visit.

Just what I wanted but nothing special. I was looking for an hotel from which I could easily walk to shinjuku and the yoyogi Park but which is not in the busy area directly. By train it was just 4 minutes but most of the time I just walked and explored the neighborhood on my way. A lot of small shrines in the area that were really stunning. Room was ok, but a little old. Especially the mattress. In some areas you could feel the springs. Bathroom could be cleaned more throughout but all in all I would recommended the hotel. Probably will go there again

Stayed 2 nights in here and I chose this hotel since it is just ONE station away from 新国立劇場 where I planned to watch a stage show there. The single room is small but with affordable price and free breakfast (toast, coffee, tea and hot soup) included, I think it is a satisfied choice for a short trip.

Small room but great value to be close to Shinjuku, the breakfast is available from 4:30 if you like to travel early and don't get into rush hour. Very friendly staff. Nice neighborhood, a lot of combini and restaurants around. There is a coin laundry at fifth floor with detergent for an extra price.

This is a gteat place to stay in Shinjuku, 24 hour reception, luggage storage, small but clean room with onsuite bathroom and breakfast was served in the morning (toast, jam, butter, peanutbutter, coffee, tea, soup). There is a station nearby, Hatagaya (but this not a metro or toei so you cannot use it with your 24 hours metro pass). Still, you can use it to get very nearby to the hotel. The staff was very friendly and helful with answering questions. It might be even better if you stay a bit longer, they have a little patio outside (we arrived well after midnight and had to check out at 10, though they serve breakfast until 11, so that's a bonus).

The hotel staff was very helpful and can communicate in English. The room was very nice and clean. Hotel guests can order food from the hotel cafe at any time of the day or night. The beds are comfortable.

the comfort and clean hotel, near by station, cafe/resto, mart. i love being here, this is our first time in Japan and this hotel makes us feel home. their staff so friendly especially a man named Hoka, a handsome-helpfull staff, he also can speak Bahasa Indonesia fluently.

The hotel location is very friendly, you can walk 3 minutes to the Hatagaya metro station or 35 minutes to Shibuya station. Good restaurants around the corner, as well as a convenience store. Very nice staff!!

The place was a good location. Only 2 stops from Shinjuku station. Only thing is it’s not on the JR line do you have to pay for a seperate ticket each time you need to get to Shinjuku. The cleaners did a great job with the rooms. The rooms are tiny and not enough for a couple with luggage. The fridge is on but does not work. If you need amenities like an iron you call reception and they tell you to go collect it from downstairs. Overall, I would not stay in this place again.

If you're skeptical about staying here, don't be. This hotel is adorable and everyone who works here is extremely helpful and kind, and their English was very good. Our room was very small, but that's what we were looking for: a very affordable place we could sleep in after going out all day! The room had everything we needed. They offer a complimentary light breakfast each morning and the soup was great. Go ahead and book!

Good community hostel feel in hotel setup. We had a room for 4 adults - 2 parents and a 15 & 18 year old. Easy. Location was both cool and central as well. Staff were welcoming and chatty; breakfast was a great starter with some basic freebies, and more available to purchase.

Great place, friendly staff. Quaint rooms (tidied daily) ensuite and simple breakfast provided each day. Good value for money, 3 minutes from Hatagaya train station close to key places to visit and hassle-free. Umbrellas provided too! Will definitely stay here again if we visit Tokyo. Thank you, Sakura staff.

This was my first trip to Japan. The room was quite small, but we only needed it as a place to sleep after exploring Tokyo most of the day. The staff were really attentive, kind, and spoke English pretty well. The hotel location avoids the busy-ness of downtown Tokyo, but is really close to train station entrances and convenient stores. I'd say the location was a real winner.

The hotel staff were very helpful and friendly. The room was small and a bit old and tired, the location was reasonable. Over all it’s ok if you don’t expect too much. I’m not sure that I would stay there again, but I haven’t ruled it out completely.

I really loved staying here! Right beside Hatagaya station which was extremely helpful. Although the neighbourhood is quiet there are many stores that stay open 24/7. The room was small(I think that’s to be expected in Tokyo) but very clean! The hotel is older but it’s been kept very well. My friend fell ill during our stay and the hotel clerk called a hospital, made sure they could take us and then gave us a map to help us. The rest of the staff was very kind too, always smiling. If I visit Tokyo again I will be staying here.

A Nice hotel near train station. Also have convenient stores and supermarket nearby. Room is ok with private bathroom which I prefer. Staff in this hotel are very accommodating and friendly. Will be back here for sure.

It would be every better if there is an option including breakfast and breakfast with some more option. Though the simple toast and coffee breakfast is kind of nice, some salad will add more value. Soup was included and that was good.

When we arrived, it was around 11 AM, the male staff who has a good command of English described that check-in was 3 PM onwards, so he offered the luggage storage area for us to put our luggages. So we settled the billing first before proceeding to the cafe, which is just to the left of the reception.The cafe was cosy with subtle music played in the background. The people: some were chilling, some were on their laptops, some were with their group, laughing and sharing stories. Since we are Muslims, we are delighted that the cafe offered Muslim-friendly menu, properly labelled on the display. Food arrived within a 10 minutes (or less) wait.Near the toilet, a prayer room is provided- which is really convenient since the room is too small for a space to pray.After 3 PM, we checked in. The interior of the lift was too red and has a claustrophobic feel for my liking, since they used a carpeted red wall (the only part of the building that irked me).The room we stayed was one double bed, for 2 people. When we opened the door, it was only enough for the entry of one person at a time, immediate left is a mirror and a place to hang our clothes, and to the right is the toilet. You have the double bed near to the table and TV. Small space for walking but it does its job when your focus is travelling and only require the room to sleep in.Amenities like, hair dryer, slippers, towels, toothbrush and toothpaste, cups were provided. There is free shaver and shaving gel that can be taken near the receptionist.The hotel is conveniently located near the Hatagaya train station (within a 5 minutes walk), which you take a 130 Yen ticket per person on the New Koei Line to go to Shinjuku (to use JR pass). There are convenient stores located really near the hotel: Lawson, Family Mart. There is also a 100 Yen shop near the train station.So far, the stay was good and we really loved the helpful and polite staff. We can freely take the water in the cafe or buy our own instant noodle and use the hot water in the cafe.Thanks for the great stay!

Location is near central tokyo, only 2 station from shinjuku koei new line to hatagaya station, and from hatagaya station is less than 5 minutes walk. Overall value is fair enough. For breakfast i suggest more variance than bread.

The staff were warm, friendly and accommodating, providing helpful advice and assistance with anything I needed throughout my stay. I have visited this hotel a number of times over the last couple of years and have never felt let down by the staff, facilities or cleanliness. Being centrally located, this modest hotel has a great deal to offer, and despite its central location is quiet, which meant I could get a good nights sleep. Not only that, the food is delicious, with much of it being locally produced and organic. I'm already planning my next trip and I will almost certainly book another stay at the Sakura Hotel in Hatagaya. It is an excellent hotel with some of the most wonderful staff I have ever had the good fortune of meeting and it says a lot when you miss the staff as much as the country itself.

It was a very nice place, you have everything you need to rest after being around Tokyo. Also you can be part of different activities that are prepared for the guests so you will enjoy meeting new people while you discover everything about Japanese culture. If you need anything or have doubts, you can ask the staff, they are always in good mood to help you. I really liked that.

I first stayed at Sakura Hotel Ikebukuro in 2013 which familiarized me with the chain of hotels. I chose Hatagaya this time because of the location, and I was not disappointed. The room and bathroom was clean and ample for my stay. However, I must admit that the walls are quite thin as I could hear my neighbors enjoying their evening a little too loudly :P

Very nice environment, restaurants, 24hrs shops, postage office nearby. And outdoor eating area provided. Front desk receptionist are very nice and helpful.I like the rooms setting for day lights penetrate inside the room. Looks great and energetic in every morning before I go out.Thank you!

Had rather low expectations due to the low price compared with other hotels near by. Pleasantly surprised by the amenities and friendly staff! Definitely worth every penny. If I need a hotel next time, I'm going to go back!

Sakura Hotel Hatagaya is a little far from the Shinjuku Transport Hub and because of this there is a time constraint set if you have no transport available except the subway which runs up 12mn. The rooms were a tight squeeze; comfortable and clean yet manageable. The staff were proficient in English and very knowledgeable about directions to and from destinations. However, because of the centralized heating and air-conditioning system you are unable to control the temperature of your room. I would come back when in Tokyo.

Convenient location, 1 min walk from Hatagaya metro station, which is 2 stations away from Shinjuku which takes you everywhere. Basic breakfast included but other meals are available if you like. Quiet place at night, no street noise either so perfect to sleep. All staff members speak a really good English and they are always available and helpful. I made a second reservation to extend my stay in a different room and they were kind enough to let me switch my bags before official check in time, thank you for that! Safe and convenient luggage storage by the way if you arrive early or need to catch a late plane after checking out. Nice walk through residential areas to reach Yoyogi park to get away from the fuss of Shinjuku and Shibuya which can be overwhelming after a while. I will definitely stay there next time I come to Tokyo!

The place is cute, a little shabby but charming. I like the 24 hour cafe and good location. It wasn't expensive, so I didn't have high expectations. We would have been happy with our room, except that the bathroom smelled TERRIBLE. Like, we're not picky. I tried to brush my teeth and almost hurled. After a few hours of being in our room and the smell not getting better, we asked to be transferred to a new room. At first the woman said they were full and it wasn't possible, but my boyfriend asked "can you check?" and the woman was like "oh, we do have a room." She didn't seem happy at all, and I understand that it is an inconvenience, but really if they hadn't wanted to move us they shouldn't have put us in the poo room. I did notice when we first went in the room, the window was open, so perhaps they thought it would air out before we got there, so that in itself is understandable, but the attitude wasn't cool. We got moved to a tiny room with a view of the stairwell, so we had to keep our curtains closed for privacy for our remaining 4 nights there. I really wanted to like this place, and it had some nice things about it, but the way they handled their mistake was unprofessional and left me a bit salty.

We booked the traditional Japanese room for our first few nights at Sakura Hotel Hatagaya and we're surprised and pleased at the size and amenities. 24 hour cafe with options for different diets and a prayer room made for a welcoming and inclusive environment. We had a six year old child who was well accommodated. Staff were helpful. Very close to transport and shops. We will return!

Room: Double Room CornerBed - Bed was spacious than I thought. It could fit me, my husband and my 1-year daughter. (Me and my husband is plus-size so I'm quite suprised it could fit us all three)Room - Room was great. It's completed with TV, refrigerator and couch.Location - Location was perfect as it's near the city area. Hotel only 5 min walk from Hatagaya station (Keio new line). Train station exit to the hotel is equipped with elevator.Cafe - Food was great. There was a quite variety of Halal menu so you can try different food everytime. The halal menu sold out fast so better try it as soon as you can.Laundry - Laundry is a bit dissapointing as it was very limited. Laundry only available at 5th floor, and they only have 2 washer and 2 dryer. The people on 5th floor seems to conquer it as I've encounter numerous case where the machine was done yet no one pick the clothes. Then when I check againb5 min later, someone else as put their clother into the machine. Laundry can only be done from 10am to 10pm so if you come back to hotel at 8pm, there's a slim chance. Laundy best done on 6pm or morning at 10am before you start your day. My advice, better bring enough clothes so you dont have to waste time fight for the laundry.Overall, the stay was great and we we having a good rest while staying at Sakura Hatagaya. Will definitely come here again.

I am happy with our stay in this hotel.There are other Filipinos who checked in with usStaff are friendly.Train station and bus stops are conveniently located walking distant on this hotel.Rooms are quite small, luggage can be placed underneath your bed.

Located 2 mins to Hatagaya station. Very nice staff. Free breakfast. Clean rooms and everyday room cleaning. High value for money. Good communications. Own cafe down stairs and good meals for reasonable price. I just checked out and i am so keen to provide this good feed back for them.

There are variety moslem food and mushola.Recomended hotel to stay at Tokyo.Very close to Hatagaya Station.The staffs were very helpful in giving information, someone can speak Indonesian language.Clean room and fresh towel everiday.Nice stay, Sakura Hotel Hatagaya was very pleasant.

The hotel was easily access drom metro stationbut close enough that we could walk to shibuya shopping area and Yoyogi park. Only negative thing for us was the breakfast which was only soup, coffee or tea and bread. Room was very small for two people not enough plugs to charge phones and cameras in the room. We had drinks before bed in a bar close to the hotel called wild bushy pretty nice lady runs the bar very friendly and speaks very good english.

Old hotel, small rooms, simple accommodation, yet a clean well looked after property. Comfy bed, and a good shower/bath, was all I needed. Excellent friendly staff that give the place a real “travellers vibe” with their eagerness to help and have a chat. So many happy travellers have stayed and left photos and notes on the walls of the reception. 24 hour lobby cafe, with a world class selection of craft beers, and a simple yet extensive cafe food menu with many recipes that guests have given over the years. Was comfortable and felt at home here. Will stay again next month. Hope the internet is a little faster when I return. The WiFi in the room was a little slow,, but hanging out downstairs at the cafe had faster connection.

The place was great! It’s just a 1 minute walk from Hatagaya Station. It’s near to Family mart and kitchen origin. On top of that, the hotel staffs were all very welcoming and accommodating. Would definitely come back here !

Friendly staff. This is great place to stay for moslem because they provide halal food. The hotel also close to train station and convenient store. I went there for holiday and spent so much time outside from morning to late night, the hotel should consider the laundry time so laundry can be access anytime for guest.

I loved my stay here everything was perfect. My room was clean I must have helped me with translating some stuff. The quality of service I received here is on par with some of the five star hotels I've been to, sometimes Superior

just a few subway stops from Shinjuku, or a short bus/taxi ride from shibuya, away from tourist traps so you get experience a bit of the real Japan, 24hr bar/restaurant is convenient, as well as its location to transport, laundry, stores etc. If you're new to Japan don't be put off by the tiny rooms, that's normal. staff are helpful and friendly.

I stayed at the fantastic Sakura Hotel at Hatagaya. It was just right for my needs. Friendly staff, small compact room with en suite and easy access to the hub at Shinjuku. For a traveller having laundry facilities available and a 24 hour cafe it was perfect.

This hotel has not only English speaking staff but some of the nicest staff I have ever dealt with. The rooms are exactly what you need and they even off free breakfast. Not only that but the train station is a short walk away with other food and bar amenities close as well. When I come back, this is definitely where I'm staying.

Sakura Hotel Hatagaya is a sweet and warming home in Hatagaya, Tokyo. It was cheap and near the train station which made it very accessible and easy to get around Tokyo. Convenience Stores were everywhere which made us easy to buy our everyday essentials.Also, the Staff are friendly and nice. It was my friend's birthday eve so, we decided to celebrate on their very own mini cafe when they heard us singing a birthday song for our friend, they surprised everyone with a bottle of nice sparkling champagne. Everyone had a good time,

good location and the staff very friendly only the breakfast is bread & sop but overall is a nice place ..we love to stay here only 2 station from shinjuku and many store around this area you can easy to find near the hatagaya station

Rooms are smallish and beds are typically Japanese (a bit firm), but the price is reasonable, location is great, and staff were awesome. Feels like a hostel but with much nicer rooms and of course with the usual hotel considerations. Bar and cafe are a nice addition; like the hotel, not fancy, but friendly and nice. Highly recommended if you aren't looking for luxury (but we felt happy to come back to our room to rest and relax at the end of each day).

The first time i entered the Hotel, it had a very Warm, cozy and Homely vibe to it. This atop the Super friendly staff made me feel as if i were staying at a home away from home.Coming from a country where we have huge houses, i did find the room quite small, but then again, cant complain it being Tokyo. I actually liked the room, although it is small, it has all amenities you would need.The Food at the hotel is pretty good and they also have a wide selection of beers( Local beers and international ones).The hotel does come with Complementary Breakfast which is quite amazing considering the inexpensive price , but there is room for improvement.More variety can be added.The hotel is a mere 2 minute walk from the Hatagaya Metro station, which is one of the best things about the hotel, this makes it very accessible to any district via the metro. There are lot of Convenience stores and eateries close by too.The hotel staff are just amazing and very friendly, they were always there to help.Overall i would say this hotel has a great value for money, considering its prime location;Great for tourists who require a place to sleep after a day of site seeing.

Great budget hotel. Very accessible since train station is about 2 mins walk. Hotel staff were very accommodating and friendly. Food in the cafe was good too. Family Mart and reataurants available in the area about 1 minute away.

The hotel is simple and clean, located close to the Hatagaya station with a lot of reasonably priced eateries around. Friendly English speaking staff, who is very willing to share info with the guests.

very nice, comfortable, the staff is friendly and very helpful and serves halal food. if there is a chance to return to Japan, we will choose to stay there again. I hope this good quality will be maintained.

Sakura Hotel Hatagaya is really a great place to stay. It's value for money. The location is fantastic near Hatagaya station which is only 2 stops away from Shinjuku. The surrounding area is safe and have convenient stores and cafes/restaurants all within walking distance. The staff are friendly, helpful and able to communicate in English. We had an earthquake experience while staying here but the staff is able to explain and provide us assurance that everything is fine. My only suggestion for improvement is on the daily breakfast which could offer more variety in different days eg. oats or cereals. The room is small but then again that is expected for the price that you pay in Tokyo. Overall, this is a great place for family to stay and will definitely consider Sakura Hotel Hatagaya if I ever come to Tokyo again.

Nice Location, friendly staff and best price include breakfast.. this is the second time I'm select Sakura Hotel.. Both time also having a great moment when stay here.. strongly recommend for who travel to Tokyo soon...

This is my second stay at Sakura Hotel Hatagaya and I enjoyed my stay again. The only thing I missed though was the halal curry rice from Sakura Cafe which I loved during my first stay. I hope they would bring it back if I ever come back again. It was really delicious.

We found this to be a good value option when travelling with our 4 kids. We booked a triple room and a twin room and had the kids in one room (2 shared the double bed which was a reasonable size, the others had full-size single beds) and we had the twin room. The twin room had a double bed (which was a good size for the two of us) and a single. The rooms were small but clean and comfortable. Bathrooms are very small but adequate. The hotel is close to the subway making it a great base to explore Tokyo. Staff are friendly and helpful.

A great location to stay, close to city centre and most importantly to a subway station. Breakfast is provided but it’s really basic to get you started for the day, don’t expect a full course breakfast.

The room was a good size. The air conditioner worked wonderfully and the bed was comfortable.Staff are easy to talk to, helpful. Hotel location is great, can take the train to most locations or a 30-minute-ish walk to Shibuya station and the food, entertainment and shopping there.I was there for New Years, and there were cultural experiences available and staff ready to answer questions or offer something unique.The bathroom did sometimes have a smell from the pipes, but it wasn't severe. The cleaning staff were also super friendly and sweet, and did their jobs very efficiently.
